meanings.definition: The width of a hand, typically about four inches.
meanings.sent1: She measured the bookshelf using a handbreadth to make sure it would fit.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a handbreadth to mark where to cut the wood.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to catch the moving handbreadth, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The handbreadth of sunlight peeking through the curtains illuminated the room.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's cookies were always just a handbreadth away from perfection.

meanings.definition: A small unit of measurement equal to the width of a hand.
meanings.sent1: He estimated the distance as a handbreadth and was surprised by how close he was.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a handbreadth to ensure the perfect fit of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored nuts in a handbreadth-sized hole in the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The handbreadth of snow on the ground made everything look magical.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted with a handbreadth brush to add intricate details to the portrait.
